overview: Amos was a shepherd called to confront Israel's social injustice and empty religion. His message insists that true worship produces justice for the poor and oppressed.

verses.text: But let justice roll down like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
Seek good, and not evil, that you may live; and so the LORD, the God of hosts, will be with you, as you have said.
For the Lord GOD does nothing without revealing his secret to his servants the prophets.

passages.title: Justice and Worship
passages.summary: God rejects Israel's festivals and songs because they're accompanied by injustice. He demands righteousness as the fruit of true worship.

facts.text: Amos 5:24 was a favorite verse of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., who quoted it in his 'I Have a Dream' speech.
Amos was neither a professional prophet nor a prophet's sonâ€”just a shepherd and farmer whom God called.
Though Amos was from Judah (south), God sent him to prophesy against Israel (north) during its prosperous years.

figures.name: Amos
figures.description: A shepherd from Tekoa who was called to deliver God's message of justice to a complacent, prosperous Israel.

videos.title: Amos Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Amos's call for justice to flow like a river.
